ANSWERS.C8.1: Increasing speed often reduces accuracy due to time constraints, while higher accuracy typically requires more time for verification.
ANSWERS.C8.2: Reliability is the probability that a system will perform its intended function without failure under stated conditions for a specified period.
ANSWERS.C8.3: Constraint adherence means strictly following all specified limitations and requirements throughout the process.
ANSWERS.C8.4: Calibration is the process of adjusting a system to match a known standard or reference.
ANSWERS.C8.5: Planning under limits involves identifying constraints early and designing solutions that operate within those boundaries.
